2ndInt1: ^Our second evening in the warehouse was more gruelling than the last. It’s starting to take its toll on me, I think. We get home exhausted.
^Hunter: Please tell me that’s the last time we’re going in there.
^Janet: I don’t know if we can rule that out just yet.
^Hunter: Really? Why would we possibly need to go back there?
^Janet: For one, we don’t know where [Player]’s mom is, still.
^Hunter: I can’t believe I’m the one saying this, but maybe now we go to the police.
^Janet: I don’t know if it’s safe for us to do that.
^Janet: These guys, this Echelon Institute, they seem pretty well connected. To have the firepower they do in there… they must know people in high places.
^Hunter: All the more reason to call the police and trust in good old law and order.
^Hunter: Wha-? [Player], that was uncalled for, right? Can you tell her that was uncalled for?

^Janet: It was completely deserved. If this Echelon Institute has the power to get those weapons in there, they certainly have the power to arrest us for breaking and entering, and assault, regardless of their wrongdoings.
^Player: Okay, so what do we do now?
^Janet: Let’s take stock of what we found.
^Janet: I looked it over, it’s more than just a memo. This keeps coming up.
^Janet: Operation 8450. Whatever it is, it’s important to them.
^Janet: That’s right. They’re trying hard to keep this under wraps.
^Janet: Well, they say they’re spending a lot of money on ads against magic. I think I’ve even seen some of these ads; saying it’s unnatural and dangerous.
^Hunter: But we can acknowledge that magic isn’t ‘normal,’ right?
^Janet: I- I can’t have this argument right now. [Player]?

s: ^Hunter, you’re out of line, but let’s move on.
^I kind of agree, Hunter, but let’s stay on track.

c-1: ^Hunter: Wow, okay. Yeah let’s go on.

AfterChoice: ^Janet: Anyway, there’s definitely a lot going on at the Echelon Institute that we don’t fully understand.
^Janet: I’m thinking we need to go back. Even if we don’t figure out what they’re doing, we need to find [Player]’s mom.
^Janet: We look for clues that point us in her direction. [Player]?
^Player: Okay, we go back one more time. But that’s it. Things are getting dangerous.
^Janet: Great, we’ll meet up here at the same time tomorrow.
^Hunter: Wait, don’t I get a say?
^Janet: Do you want to skip out on tomorrow?
^Hunter: No, I’ll go with you guys.
^Janet: Good. Now let’s let [Player] get some rest.
^I bid Janet and Hunter good night, and they head home.
warehouseExt3: ^After yet another night of restless sleep, and a listless Sunday spent waiting for the evening, it is eventually time for me to head down to the warehouse. I meet Janet and Hunter there and wordlessly- our moods grim- we enter the warehouse for the last time.
